By selectively doping regions with impurities, engineers create P-N junctions that form transistors, the fundamental switching elements of all digital and analog electronics. The fab process etches billions of these transistors onto wafers to produce chip dies. Moore's Law has driven exponential scaling for decades, pushing from micron-scale features to sub-3nm process nodes.
